resources.string: Piano Music Drum Pad : Piano Keyboard
Piano Music Drum Pad : Piano Keyboard

- This Application is developed for convenience of app user to get piano keyboard at one place 

 - All the images or sound are copied or downloaded from the internet or free domain , app do not claiming to be an owner of any assets

 - App not taking any money or will not responsible for any kind of transaction fail or success or any kind of payment issue

 - For any privacy or copyrights related issue please mail us at :-
"Hi there, I'm using “Piano Music Drum Pad : Piano Keyboard” app , click to get it now:-"
Test your knowledge of Chords with this game. Check your results from the progress button on the main menu.
Press the \'Play\' button to start the challenge. The app will randomly choose a chord from the level you selected and root note you chose.
Press the \'Check\' button to see if you have played the chord correctly. This will be automated, so really can be used to end the challenge early.
Type a name for the file:
Select number of notes to play
Select the \'Level\' button to change the level. You can program which chords to be included in the \\\'My Focus Group\\\' item.
Press the \'Root Note\' button to change the root note (e.g. C, F, Eb etc). This forms the basis for the chords.
Learn your chords. Either play and repeat, or use as a reference.
Press the \'Root Note\' button to change the root note (e.g. C, F, Eb etc). This forms the basis for the chords.
Press the \'Choose Chord\' button and select the chord you wish to learn or view as a reference.
Select the \'Play\' button to play the chord. After listening, play the chord back on the keyboard.
Then, select the \'Check\' button to check if you played the chord correctly.
Select the \'Reference\' button to see the pattern of the chords as a reference. You should turn it off when testing yourself on the scales.
Test your knowledge of Scales with this game. Check your results from the progress button on the main menu.
Press the \'Play\' button to start the challenge. The app will randomly choose a scale from the level you selected and root note you chose.
Press the \'Check\' button to see if you have played the scale correctly. This will be automated, so really can be used to end the challenge early.
Select the \'Level\' button to change the level. You can program which scales to be included in the \'My Focus Group\' item.
Press the \'Root Note\' button to change the root note (e.g. C, F, Eb etc). This forms the basis for the scales.
\'Scale Direction\' if you want to perform the scales descending or both ascending and descending.
Learn your scales. Either play and repeat, or use as a reference.
Press the \'Root Note\' button to change the root note (e.g. C, F, Eb etc). This forms the basis for the scales.
Press the \'Choose Scale\' button and select the scale you wish to learn or view as a reference.
Select the \'Play-Stop\' button to play the scale. After listening, play the scale back on the keyboard.
Then, select the \'Check\' button to check if you played the scale correctly.
Select the \'Reference\' button to see the pattern of the scales as a reference. You should turn it off when testing yourself on the scales.
\'Scale Direction\' if you want to perform the scales descending or both ascending and descending.

Learn to jam and improvise in any key. Choose a key and play within the highlighted notes to create a melody or chord progression. Start with the core note of the key with another one and then build up.
Press the \'Root Note\' button to change the root note (e.g. C, F, Eb etc). This forms the basis for the keys.
Press the \'Key\' button and select the key you wish to jam in. (E.g. C Major, C Minor if C was the root note). Then jam away.
Want to record a melody? Select the \'Record\' button and play. Select the \'Record\' button again to stop recording.
Select the \'Play-Stop\' button to play the recording or play a saved recording you have just opened.
Select the \'Open-Save\' button to open a previously saved tune or save the tune you have just recorded.
Select the \'Metronome\' button to start the beat. A long press will go into the metronome settings.
Select a chord button to highlight the main notes in the chord within the key.
Select a recommended chord button. The recommended chord buttons follow the key\'s standard chord progression formula.
Listen and learn some of the best user melodies.
Press the \'Choose Tune\' button and select the melody you wish to listen to.
Select the \'Play-Stop\' button to play the song. After listening, play the song back on the keyboard.
Then, select the \'Check\' button to check if you played the song back correctly.
Select the \'Numbers\' button to limit the number of notes to play back.
The app will recognise what scales/chords you play.
Play a scale or chord then press the \'Record\' button to stop listening. The app will then tell you what you played.
Press the \'Sharp-Flat\' button to toggle the note names to be a flat or sharp.
Select the \'Refresh\' button to refresh the screen, and unhighlight the notes.
Please spare a moment to rate and give your valuable feedback to us before leaving.

Helps identify incoming and outgoing call states.
